column4: Hi, just installed breezy, is it normal that the research I make in synaptic take very long time to complete and take uge amount of ressource
when it starts up first it has to get a couple of megs of material are you on dialup or dsl?
t1
that means nothing to me what is that 56k or something?
it is lan connection, high speed
on how big a machine?
centrino 1.4GhZ, 256 ram
it seems to me it is making too much of a load, any chance you could paste the output of /etc/apt/sources.list into http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
just a sec
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/6850
looking at it give me a min
I closed synaptic and re-opened it, it seems better now
just a moment there are some things in there that you might consider changing
before you do you should back that file up
ok
if I was you I would remove the reference to the cdrom at the top of the file - open up the two universe sec repos on the bottom
ok, for security :)
thanks, is it normal that openoffice is very slow startup?
other things are you lack multiverse if you are true gnu you don't want them but if you do you should put it on the end of *only the first* line of universe half way up the file

with those hardware specs yes, in fact it could be said that it is a dog at starting up but not bad at all once opened I have been editing a single doc here for the last few hours on and off as I review and recreate it and no issue and my box is of similar power to yours
ok, thank you again :)
when the edit is finished on the command line run this >> sudo apt-get update<<
